Game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player class acting as a model, storing a player's name, score, inventory, pets and their money. Player's score is determined by a pet's stat percentages as well as how much money the player has left at the end of the game. If a pet has died, the player will be penalized. Player can also interact with pets, such as feeding,playing, disciplining, healing, putting a pet to sleep and letting a pet use the toilet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.util.ArrayList<Pets> petsInput,
              java.lang.String nameInput)
        Constructor to create player, given a name and Array of pets. Used for testing, not in the game logic.
        Parameters:
        petsInput - The given ArrayList of the player's pets from from GameGUI during player set up.
        nameInput - Name the player.

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String nameInput)
        Overloaded constructor to create a player base, with no pets. The pest will be allocated after the player has chosen them in the pet set up, determined by the controller in GameGUI.
        Parameters:
        nameInput - The name of the player.

      • playWithPet

        public java.lang.String playWithPet(Pets pet,
                                    Item item)
        Method for the player to play with their pet using a toy from their inventory. The toy will take durability damage and their pet will become happier.
        Parameters:
        pet - Pet that will play with a toy. Pet's stats will change.
        item - Toy takes damage to durability.
        Returns:
        A confirmation string

        Parameters:

        item - Food Object to be eaten by the pet.

      • addItem

        public void addItem(Item item)
        Adds a specified item into the player's inventory. Increases the stack if it's stackable and is already in the inventory, else adds is added to the inventory as a separate item.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to be added

      • hasInventorySpace

        public boolean hasInventorySpace(Item item)
        If determining if there is inventory space to add a consumable item (i.e. Food/Medicine), always return true as they are 'stackable' in the player's inventory. If room for a toy is being determined, return true if the player does not have the toy yet. If the player does already have the toy in their inventory return false. A player can only have one each toy in their inventory at a time.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to check whether there is space in the player's inventory to add.
        Returns:
        Boolean value true if there is space, false if there is no space.
